newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Intel firms.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Intel firms.

text.p: Intel Corp shares firmed preceding Wednesday's U.S. market open, gains traders attributed to postive analyst comments.

Ahead of the opening bell, Intel added one to 134-1/4 after Donaldson Lufkin & Jenrette analyst Krishna Shankar said in a research note that he finds the stock "more attractive at current valuation levels..."
The analyst left unchanged his market perform rating and his earnings forecasts, according to the note.

Elsewhere, FSI International Inc shares fell to 11 from 13-1/16 after the company said after last night's market close that it expects 1997 fiscal year sales to be 15 to 20 percent below the $304 million reported in fiscal 1996.
Traders also said the stock was weakened by the company's fiscal second quarter results, also announced last night, which came in slightly under Wall Street estimates.
For the period ended March 1, the company netted $0.08 per share, $0.01 under analysts' consensus view, traders said.
FSI earned $0.37 per share in the year-ago period.

Elsewhere, Macromedia Inc rallied to 8-1/2 from 7-3/4, XcelleNet Inc fell to 17-3/8 from 17-5/8 after the company issued a secondary offering of shares priced below the market, and MRV Communications added 1-1/2 to 20-1/2 after the company said it expects first quarter revenues to more than double from the year-ago period.
